sentences.en: A few lucky survivors, who were able to find a hiding spot inside the mast of the boat, were horrified as they watched the Maori devour their shipmates through the night and in to the next morning.

And the streams that wash down from the glacier-capped peaks carry a highly prized stone, a hard, translucent, green rock that the Maori carved into jewelry and blades, for both tools and weapons.
sentences.cn: 从冰川包覆的山巅冲击而下的湍流携下一种具有很高价值的玉石，毛利人将这种硬质半透明的石头雕刻成为珠宝和刀刃，既是工具也可以作为武器。

sentences.en: Coal Island was visited first by the early Maori. In addition, gold was discovered in 1874.

sentences.en: Maori cannibalism has been stamped out in New Zealand and many (but not all) of the archipelagos to its north.
sentences.cn: 而在新西兰和新西兰以北的大部分群岛上，毛利人的食人陋习已被扑灭。

sentences.en: Maori families enjoy sharing what they own and looking after one another.
sentences.cn: 毛利人的家庭喜欢共享他们拥有的东西,并乐意彼此照顾.

sentences.en: Special days for the Maori are called huis.
sentences.cn: 毛利人的特殊节日叫做“会”.

sentences.en: The common meeting place for Maori is on the marae.
sentences.cn: 毛利人在广场上开普通的会议.

sentences.en: The earliest people of New Zealand is Maori.
sentences.cn: 新西兰最早的居民是毛利人.

sentences.en: The English and Maori versions of the treaty both contain three articles.

sentences.en: The Maori came from the island of Polynesia in the Pacific.

sentences.en: The Maori were the earliest people to come to New Zealand.
sentences.cn: 毛利人是来到新西兰的最早的人种.

sentences.en: The marae - the meeting house and the land around it - is the focus of Maori community life.
sentences.cn: 马拉埃 -- 聚会大厅及其周围土地 -- 是毛利人村社生活的中心.

sentences.en: They also have Maori newspapers, radio and TV programmers.
